page.title: 18CRAIG COILLICH POND PROJECT
page.content: The project which involved the reclamation of a small pond on the out skirts of Ballater was the Field Centre's contribution to the Council of Europe's Campaign on The Water's Edge, 1984. Funding for the project was received from The Prince's Trust and permission was kindly given by the Factor of Glen Muick Estate. The work was undertaken by Centre staff and a group of young volunteers during the first week of the summer holidays 1984 The work involved the removal of litter and vegetation, the construction of a rigid sampling platform and a walkway across the fragile pond margins. A Certificate of Merit was received for this work. The pond is now the focus of the Centre's unit of study on Freshwater habitats. Maintainance of the pond environs is undertaken by Centre staff.
